The Musical Instrument of the Human Body

A musical instrument is a large wooden body, such as a cello, a harp, or a flute, with a flexible neck which is connected to a vibrating bridge. In addition to vibrating strings, the instrument is supported by another set of strings (or 'cords') on the side of the body.

A musical instrument, like a typewriter, is a mechanical system in which a string is attached to the keys. The strings are connected to the mechanism by a set of pegs or screws, which make a connection with the paper in which it is written, or which are attached to the string by a pin or bar. The sound is produced by the force of the spring pressing down on the strings.
